column4: Ohhh, another question; firefox keeps going frozen grey and dim for 30s at a time, every install, even doing it in lucid. any hints how to troubleshoot this?
perhaps you should just say whatever you wanted to say?
yeah, I think I spent too much time in squeze already
should just be a matter on installing the 'grub' package and running update-grub ?
I have the package, now the purpose of update-grub is unclear to me. I run grub-install, which seems to work fine
I don't need that, menu.lst is already correct
there's a way to install grub from the grub command line too, probably !grub links to it ;)
so what was the question anyway?
the question is why does it produce "error 22" on boot...
probably confusion between where BIOS sees devices and where grub sees them
check the boot order if you have more than one drive, you may be booting from an old broken mbr on the wrong drive?
I've already looked at that... booting from /dev/sdc, root fs is /dev/sda2, /boot is /dev/sda1
